Cloud API

Quickstart

Learn how to get started with the Browser Use Cloud API

The Browser Use Cloud API lets you create and manage browser automation agents programmatically. Each agent can execute tasks and provide real-time feedback through a live preview URL.

​
Prerequisites

You need an active subscription and an API key from cloud.browser-use.com/billing

​
Pricing

The Browser Use Cloud API is priced at $0.05 per step that agent executes.

Since Browser Use has the ability to execute multiple steps at the same time, the price for filling out forms much lower than other services.

​
Creating Your First Agent

Create a new browser automation task by providing instructions in natural language:

Copy
curl -X POST https://api.browser-use.com/api/v1/run-task \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer your_api_key_here" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "task": "Go to google.com and search for Browser Use"
  }'

The API returns a task ID that you can use to manage the task and check the live preview URL.

The task response includes a live_url that you can embed in an iframe to watch and control the agent in real-time.

​
Managing Tasks

Control running tasks with these operations:

Temporarily pause task execution with /api/v1/pause-task and resume with /api/v1/resume-task. Useful for manual inspection or intervention.

Permanently stop a task using /api/v1/stop-task. The task cannot be resumed after being stopped.

For detailed API documentation, see the tabs on the left, which includes the full coverage of the API.

​
Building your own client (OpenAPI)

We recommend this only if you don’t need control and only need to run simple tasks.

The best way to build your own client is to use our OpenAPI specification to generate a type-safe client library.

​
Python

Use openapi-python-client to generate a modern Python client:

Copy
# Install the generator
pipx install openapi-python-client --include-deps

# Generate the client
openapi-python-client generate --url http://api.browser-use.com/openapi.json

This will create a Python package with full type hints, modern dataclasses, and async support.

​
TypeScript/JavaScript

For TypeScript projects, use openapi-typescript to generate type definitions:

Copy
# Install the generator
npm install -D openapi-typescript

# Generate the types
npx openapi-typescript http://api.browser-use.com/openapi.json -o browser-use-api.ts

This will create TypeScript definitions that you can use with your preferred HTTP client.

Need help? Contact our support team at support@browser-use.com or join our Discord community

Was this page helpful?

##### API v1.0
  * [POSTRun Task](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/</cloud/api-v10/run-task>)
  * [PUTStop Task](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/</cloud/api-v10/stop-task>)
  * [PUTPause Task](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/</cloud/api-v10/pause-task>)
  * [PUTResume Task](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/</cloud/api-v10/resume-task>)
  * [GETGet Task](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/</cloud/api-v10/get-task>)
  * [GETGet Task Status](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/</cloud/api-v10/get-task-status>)

  * [GETMe](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/</cloud/api-v10/me>)
  * [GETPing](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/</cloud/api-v10/ping>)


The Browser Use Cloud API lets you create and manage browser automation agents programmatically. Each agent can execute tasks and provide real-time feedback through a live preview URL.
## 
[​](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/<#prerequisites>)
Prerequisites
You need an active subscription and an API key from [cloud.browser-use.com/billing](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/<https:/cloud.browser-use.com/billing>)
## 
[​](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/<#pricing>)
Pricing
The Browser Use Cloud API is priced at **$0.05 per step** that agent executes.
Since Browser Use has the ability to execute multiple steps at the same time, the price for filling out forms much lower than other services.
## 
[​](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/<#creating-your-first-agent>)
Creating Your First Agent
Create a new browser automation task by providing instructions in natural language:
Copy
```
curl -X POST https://api.browser-use.com/api/v1/run-task \
 -H "Authorization: Bearer your_api_key_here" \
 -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
 -d '{
  "task": "Go to google.com and search for Browser Use"
 }'

```

The API returns a task ID that you can use to manage the task and check the live preview URL.
The task response includes a `live_url` that you can embed in an iframe to watch and control the agent in real-time.
## 
[​](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/<#managing-tasks>)
Managing Tasks
Control running tasks with these operations:
Pause/Resume Tasks
Temporarily pause task execution with `/api/v1/pause-task`[](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/</cloud/api-v1/pause-task>) and resume with `/api/v1/resume-task`[](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/</cloud/api-v1/resume-task>). Useful for manual inspection or intervention.
Stop Tasks
Permanently stop a task using `/api/v1/stop-task`[](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/</cloud/api-v1/stop-task>). The task cannot be resumed after being stopped.
For detailed API documentation, see the tabs on the left, which includes the full coverage of the API.
## 
[​](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/<#building-your-own-client-openapi>)
Building your own client (OpenAPI)
We recommend this only if you don’t need control and only need to run simple tasks.
The best way to build your own client is to use our [OpenAPI specification](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/<http:/api.browser-use.com/openapi.json>) to generate a type-safe client library.
### 
[​](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/<#python>)
Python
Use to generate a modern Python client:
Copy
```
# Install the generator
pipx install openapi-python-client --include-deps
# Generate the client
openapi-python-client generate --url http://api.browser-use.com/openapi.json

```

This will create a Python package with full type hints, modern dataclasses, and async support.
### 
[​](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/<#typescript-javascript>)
TypeScript/JavaScript
For TypeScript projects, use to generate type definitions:
Copy
```
# Install the generator
npm install -D openapi-typescript
# Generate the types
npx openapi-typescript http://api.browser-use.com/openapi.json -o browser-use-api.ts

```

This will create TypeScript definitions that you can use with your preferred HTTP client.
Need help? Contact our support team at or join our [Discord community](https://docs.browser-use.com/cloud/<https:/link.browser-use.com/discord>)
